intro: Polemoniella antarctica f. typica, commonly known as the Antarctic polemonium, is a rare and specialized flowering plant native to the cold climates of Antarctica. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure adapted to survive in extreme conditions. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom during the brief Antarctic summer. Its leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs to reduce water loss and protect against harsh winds. Due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations, it is considered a valuable subject for studying plant survival in extreme environments.
